Sentencas: Alkaline earth metal vanadates have drawn attention because of their potential applications in electro-chemical devices.
Titulo: Phase transformation and ionic conductivity mechanism of a low-temperature sintering semiconductor Na2CaV4O12

Sentencas: Here, Na2CaV4O12 was prepared at extremely low temperatures (350-550 degrees C) and showed a semiconductor behavior with a bandgap of 2.92 eV.
Titulo: Phase transformation and ionic conductivity mechanism of a low-temperature sintering semiconductor Na2CaV4O12

Sentencas: A phase transition from P4/nbm to P (4) over bar b2 occurred at 510 degrees C was identified by an in-situ XRD upon heating, where the 16 n site for oxygen atoms in the P4/nbm phase evolves into two distinguishable 8i sites in the P (4) over bar b2 phase.
Titulo: Phase transformation and ionic conductivity mechanism of a low-temperature sintering semiconductor Na2CaV4O12

Sentencas: Ionic conduction in Na2CaV4O12 at elevated temperatures was reported for the first time in the present work.
Titulo: Phase transformation and ionic conductivity mechanism of a low-temperature sintering semiconductor Na2CaV4O12

Sentencas: A strong correlation between ionic conductivity and phase structure of Na2CaV4O12 is observed.
Titulo: Phase transformation and ionic conductivity mechanism of a low-temperature sintering semiconductor Na2CaV4O12

Sentencas: The charged carriers are mainly sodium ions for the low-temperature P4Inbm phase, while mixed conduction contributed by sodium ions and oxide ions happened in the transformed phase.
Titulo: Phase transformation and ionic conductivity mechanism of a low-temperature sintering semiconductor Na2CaV4O12

Sentencas: Bond valence-based energy landscape calculations disclosed a two-dimensional interstitial diffusion mechanism for Na+ ions in the Na2Ca-layers, as well as a two-dimensional diffusion mechanism for oxide ions in the V4O12-layers.
Titulo: Phase transformation and ionic conductivity mechanism of a low-temperature sintering semiconductor Na2CaV4O12

Sentencas: The novel semiconductor ceramic would have potential applications in all-solid sodium ions batteries or solid oxide fuel cells as electrolytes.
Titulo: Phase transformation and ionic conductivity mechanism of a low-temperature sintering semiconductor Na2CaV4O12
